title: Accounting Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was on zoom- I meet with two managers who asked relatively simple interview questions. It felt comfortable and we took the time getting to know each other. I felt like this interview helped me prepare for my interviews down the road.
Interview Questions: What does your past experience look like?

title: Academic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: The group assembled was very pleasant and spent about an hour asking questions. They also provided a lot of information about their school and department. I left really wishing that I could work there!
Interview Questions: They first ask you about your faith and whether or not you'd feel comfortable working in their environment.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen followed by on-campus interview in a conference room with a panel. Then, a final on campus interview with the department head. References were checked. Entire process took three weeks.
Interview Questions: Could you tell us how the role relates to the University mission

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: The first round was very quick because they sent a large list of questions that I could prep answers for beforehand and said they'd ask more personalized questions after that. So I rushed through my answers for the initial list, but then they didn't have any personalized questions. Unsurprisingly, I didn't get a second interview.
Interview Questions: Typical questions about teaching and research experiences/philosophy, as well as some questions about my commitment to the school's values.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pitts, PA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Remote over zoom in 2021 and did not take long. I shared my experience that was relevant for the position and they offered me the position on the spot.  I have worked with them ever since and it has been rewarding.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your class schedule?

title: Associate General Counsel Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: They were very fair in their interview questions and process and very straightforward.  It was a multi day process but I learned a lot about the position and the environment of working for the university
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience in transactional work?

title: Educational Technology Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume, had an initial interview, and then a second interview with the entire department. They were all friendly and welcoming, and it was an overall pleasant and non-hostile process.
Interview Questions: What is the most difficult decision you've had to make in your professional life?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with three groups of people, panel-style.  All were really friendly, and an overall great experience. Spent about 45 minutes with each group.  I was put at ease immediately.  They even covered my parking expense which I appreciated.
Interview Questions: Usual questions:  Tell me about yourself, why do you want to work here

title: Assistant to the Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a casual conversation.  There was a phone interview with a search team and then one in person interview with the Dean and then another opportunity to meet other staff in the unit.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation if asked to do something that you knew was not ethical?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple process, not too many hard-pressed questions. The interviewers stuck to questions about my resume and experience. I was not asked to answer anything I did not already know based on my resume and cover letter.
Interview Questions: What would make you suitable for position? What is the institution's mission?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very quick and easy. Gave basic instructions and wanted to make sure you were the right fit. Work study allowed for balance and ability to do school  work. Flexible scheduling.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in customer service?

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: The process involved three separate meetings.    The first meeting was a panel interview with representatives from the department and HR and the Provost office.  The second interview was a panel interview with key personnel from the department. The third meeting was with the department head.
Interview Questions: What makes you a better candidate than the other applicants

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: They did a great job keeping me in the loop and giving me an idea of what to expect.  I enjoyed the process. They were extremely professional.  It is a great university who I have a great amount of respect for.  The interview was a good length.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you faced adversity?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Typical graduate assistant interview. Depends on the specific area you are applying to. Faith and religion can be emphasized depending on the area as well. Overall was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: Was fair and at times unconventional. This is a great staff who wants to help you succeed, while also ensuring that they have an appropriate candidate for the position.
Interview Questions: How do you think you would work in a short-term depth-oriented center?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: There was a short application and a fairly short interview process since this is a work study position. I was interviewed by two people: the head manager of the department, and my own manager. It probably lasted around 20 minutes total. I was informed that I would need to be able to walk and carry things that could be heavy.
Interview Questions: Have you had any past job experience working with technology?

title: Casual Dining Food Server Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Duquesne University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process basically just asked when I could start. Asked a few questions about prior work experience (which you do not really need but is helpful to have though)
Interview Questions: 1. Do you have previous dining work experience?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions:
First interview was on Zoom -- 30 minutes in length. Nice diversity of offices represented.
Second in-person interview exhaustive and extremely well run -- six components and an even broader variety of offices and staff members.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about the mentoring program you developed.
How do we get students to seriously consider offers from alumni?
What brought you to your work in career development

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: It was very informal, mostly just checking that you are reliable person and have fairly good writing skills.  There was only one interview because it was just a summer position.
Interview Questions: What weeks are you available during the summer?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: There are no special process. I submitted my application material and they informed me later that I got it. They didn’t interview me in person. They just viewed my documents and my previous grades performance, which matched the requirements and they had an opening. So I got it.
Interview Questions: Have you ever done research work before?

title: Academic Records Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received an email stating my application was forwarded to the appropriate department. Not long afterward I received a call to schedule an interview. The interview itself lasted about 2 hours. I met with the Registrar and then with a group of employees, and with the Registrar again.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen set up through HR with manager.  Second interview with two managers and a third group interview with team members.  Process took a very long time. To complete but was worth the job
Interview Questions: Can you troubleshoot?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: A brief phone call where they asked 3-5 vaguely related questions. 80% of the time was spent describing day to day implying they had already decided to hire me. The position was offered immediately at the conclusion of the phone interview. Salary stated on phone was lowered on actual paper offer, very disappointing but still a good opportunity for a free degree. Very little of the day to day description was accurate but the job is very different depending on who you work for.
Interview Questions: Describe your familiarity with APA, MLA, and Chicago style

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: I knew the hiring advisor as I did my PhD with him. He required someone to start very soon to train first year graduate students. The job was a great match as I knew the place and work very well.
Interview Questions: How long will you be available for?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. In a week, I was interviewed by the department, it was an easy interview. They asked me about my experience in research. Two days later, I received an offer, and accepted the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience in research?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very warm interview, kind people. Professional atmosphere, rewarding experience. A great place for opportunity and professional growth. Welcoming atmosphere, please take and eager to answer questions. Eager to get to know you as a person and professional.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pitts, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: there was no interview as this position was based on my work as a doctoral student and therefore I have nothing to say here. I was forced to submit this information by glassdoor and really didnt want to
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is fairly easy when I applied graduate assistant position. If you have high GPA and maintain full-time in graduate school, you probably will get the job. But you need to keep your GPA no less than 3.5 in order to keep your job.
Interview Questions: I don't really think the interview questions are difficult, just some general questions about your classes.

title: Front Desk Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was slightly late, but the interview was brief. I was contacted one day later and hired. I was reached out to via phone and email to set up the interview.
Interview Questions: What are things you do for fun?

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied through HR, and they matched me with a job they thought I would be good at. It was a simple process. It was seamless, and it really helped me adjust to college.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Desk Aid Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Structured and to the point. All applicants were given a date to come in for an interview. Applicants knew within a week whether or not they received the position. Interviewers were very personable and kind. Extremely comfortable interview.
Interview Questions: Past work experience

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I came in for an appointment with two supervisors, and they asked me various questions about how I would handle certain situations that might be presented on the phone with a customer. They evaluated my answers, coached me on how to sound professional, and explained more about the goals and incentives that the department had to offer to its most successful employees.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a person on the phone who sounds angry or upset that you called them asking for donations for the university?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I emailed the professor and he called me for a very informal talk. We discussed my level of skill and my research interests.
He told em about benefits and research he did.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to Duquesne?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duquesne University
Interview Descriptions: I did not go through a typical formal interview, it was more of a chat with my supervisor.However,  I submitted a letter of application prior to our discussion in which I detailed the elements that make me a good candidate for the job.
Interview Questions: No unexpected questions, the employers just want to get to know you. Be yourself!

title: Computer Lab Aid Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple. There was one interview with the person that ran the lab. The interview consisted of her basically explaining how the lab operates and the responsibilities of a lab aid. There were not many questions asked of me. It was pretty much a guaranteed job offer after the interview.
Interview Questions: Would you be interested in this position knowing the responsibilities?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: No interview; Give GRE and fill up the application form.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duquesne University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: They typically hire friends/family of current employees. Interview process is fairly simple.
Interview Questions: N/A
